subject: Personal Finance
title: Price Signals
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Price Signals.

hook.text: After a hurricane, plywood prices triple. That's not price gouging â€” it's a signal saying 'send more plywood.'

buildup.text: Prices carry information. High prices tell producers to make more. Low prices say make less.

discovery.text: No one needs to plan this centrally. The price system coordinates millions of decisions automatically.

twist.text: When governments cap prices during emergencies, the signal is silenced. Supplies don't arrive.

climax.text: The debate between free markets and price controls ultimately hinges on trusting the price signal.

punchline.text: Prices are the economy's nervous system.

quiz.question: What role do prices play in an economy?
options: They signal where resources are needed most
